content: Jesus the Light of the World
But Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
Now early in the morning He came again into the temple, and all the people came to Him; and He sat down and taught them.
Then the scribes and Pharisees brought to Him a woman caught in adultery. And when they had set her in the midst,
they said to Him, “Teacher, this woman was caught in adultery, in the very act.
Now Moses, in the law, commanded us that such should be stoned. But what do You say?”
This they said, testing Him, that they might have  of which to accuse Him. But Jesus stooped down and wrote on the ground with  finger, as though He did not hear.
So when they continued asking Him, He raised Himself up and said to them,
And again He stooped down and wrote on the ground.
Then those who heard  being convicted by  conscience, went out one by one, beginning with the oldest  to the last. And Jesus was left alone, and the woman standing in the midst.
When Jesus had raised Himself up and saw no one but the woman, He said to her,
She said, “No one, Lord.”And Jesus said to her,
Then Jesus spoke to them again, saying,
Jesus Defends His Self-Witness
The Pharisees therefore said to Him, “You bear witness of Yourself; Your witness is not true.”
Jesus answered and said to them,
Then they said to Him, “Where is Your Father?”Jesus answered,
These words Jesus spoke in the treasury, as He taught in the temple; and no one laid hands on Him, for His hour had not yet come.
Jesus Predicts His Departure
Then Jesus said to them again,
So the Jews said, “Will He kill Himself, because He says, ?”
And He said to them,
Then they said to Him, “Who are You?”And Jesus said to them,
They did not understand that He spoke to them of the Father.
Then Jesus said to them,
As He spoke these words, many believed in Him.
The Truth Shall Make You Free
Then Jesus said to those Jews who believed Him,
They answered Him, “We are Abraham’s descendants, and have never been in bondage to anyone. How  You say, ?”
Jesus answered them,
Abraham’s Seed and Satan’s
They answered and said to Him, “Abraham is our father.”Jesus said to them,
Then they said to Him, “We were not born of fornication; we have one Father—God.”
Jesus said to them,
Before Abraham Was, I AM
Then the Jews answered and said to Him, “Do we not say rightly that You are a Samaritan and have a demon?”
Jesus answered,
Then the Jews said to Him, “Now we know that You have a demon! Abraham is dead, and the prophets; and You say,
Are You greater than our father Abraham, who is dead? And the prophets are dead. Who do You make Yourself out to be?”
Jesus answered,
Then the Jews said to Him, “You are not yet fifty years old, and have You seen Abraham?”
Jesus said to them,
Then they took up stones to throw at Him; but Jesus hid Himself and went out of the temple, going through the midst of them, and so passed by.
